item.title: Satechi’s 3-in-1 wireless charging pad is now faster
item.description:
Satechi has announced an updated version of its Trio Wireless Charging Pad that increases the power delivery to smartphones to 15W through an upgraded Qi2 charger. The new Satechi Qi2 Trio Wireless Charging Pad now also supports 5W fast charging for the Apple Watch, including the Series 7, 8, and 9 and both versions of the Ultra.

Made from a mix of aluminum, vegan leather, and soft silicone to prevent devices from getting scratched, the charging pad is available starting today through Satechi’s website for $129.99. That’s $10 more expensive than the original version, but in addition to potentially faster charge times, Satechi has also included some design improvements on the new Trio.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Andrew Liszewski

item.title: Concentric helps companies keep track of their sensitive data
item.description:
Enterprises have a data inventory problem. The amount of data they’re collecting and storing is increasing, and that data is being spread across disparate storage buckets. Yet many organizations rely on processes that essentially amount to pencil-and-paper methods for tracking data provenance. According to one survey, more than 50% of companies use Excel spreadsheets in […]

item.title: This new UK startup is building classic-style cars with a modern EV twist
item.description:
When U.K. custom electric car creator RBW showed off its Roadster and GT models at Monterey Car Week this year, the vehicles stunned a lot of attendees, CEO Peter Swain recently told TechCrunch. “We had four ‘wows,’ where people would go: ‘Wow, that’s beautiful. Wow, look at the interior. Wow, is it really brand new?’ […]

item.title: StrictlyVC joins its first TechCrunch Disrupt
item.description:
